alert.note: Alert for Custer (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 07 at 7:17PM CDT until June 07 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Nebraska, including the following county, Custer. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 717 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms with rain rates up to 5 inches per hour. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Broken Bow, Ansley, Merna, Mason City, Berwyn, Buckeye, Burr Oak, Cumro, Intersection of Highway 183 and Cumro Road, Block Hill Basin and Gavin Siding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
